I do not think, however, that there is a particularly pressing need to comb through the whole code base to switch to smart pointers everywhere.

  • I would prefer a more consistent and safer software implementation.
  • Further usage of smart pointers could also reduce unnecessary null pointer checks a bit more, couldn't it?

body:
>I do not think, however, that there is a particularly pressing need to comb through the whole code base to switch to smart pointers everywhere.

* I would prefer a more consistent and safer software implementation.
* Further usage of smart pointers could also [reduce unnecessary null pointer checks a bit more](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/fe589d9e7caea582beed160ad47e55f537a8403e/tensorflow/core/common_runtime/sycl/sycl_allocator.cc#L22 "Update candidate: Destructor for SYCLAllocator"), couldn't it?
